pull.title: ci: drop untrusted bpfcc tool usage
pull.body: Followup to #27360, where we migrated this job to Ubuntu 23.04, which ships with newer versions of the tools: https://packages.ubuntu.com/lunar/bpfcc-tools.

ci: remove usage of untrusted bpfcc-tools

Followup to #27360, where we migrated this job to Ubuntu 23.04, which
ships with newer versions of the tools:
https://packages.ubuntu.com/lunar/bpfcc-tools.

events.message:
ci: remove usage of untrusted bpfcc-tools

Followup to #27360, where we migrated this job to Ubuntu 23.04, which
ships with newer versions of the tools:
https://packages.ubuntu.com/lunar/bpfcc-tools.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -269,7 +269,7 @@ task:
   # Images can be found here: https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/images/os-details
   compute_engine_instance:
     image_project: ubuntu-os-cloud
-    image: family/ubuntu-2204-lts # when upgrading, check if we can drop "ADD_UNTRUSTED_BPFCC_PPA"
+    image: family/ubuntu-2304-amd64 # when upgrading, check if we can drop "ADD_UNTRUSTED_BPFCC_PPA"
comments.body: You can drop the comment too
